sentences.english: He is interested in the translation and study on chinese modern poems.
sentences.chinese: 他的最大志趣是中國現代詩歌的翻譯與研究。

sentences.english: Some like-minded people got together and set up a group.
sentences.chinese: 一些志趣相投的人聚在一起，成立了一個小組。

sentences.english: Often the article self-entertainment, quite is showing oneself to remember.
sentences.chinese: 常寫文章娛樂自己，顯示了自己的志趣。

sentences.english: Like people like to spend time with like people.
sentences.chinese: 人們通常喜歡與志趣相投的人呆在一起。

sentences.english: Because, in the first place, we and him are like-minded and share the same ideas !
sentences.chinese: 那是因爲我們和他見解略同，志趣相投。

sentences.english: What worries me is that this may result in an audience of like-minded readers.
sentences.chinese: 讓我擔憂的是這可能導致出現一羣志趣相投的讀者。

sentences.english: The three girl always stay together. They form a very close-knit group.
sentences.chinese: 這三個女孩子志趣相投，總在一起。

sentences.english: Get together often with like-minded people – see Mastermind.
sentences.chinese: 經常和一些志趣相投的人聚聚。

definition: one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
interest/point of particular charm and interest
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
to go well together/to be compatible/to cater to/to please
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
